metadata.title: CVE-2020-13584 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable use-after-free vulnerability exists in WebKitGTK browserversion 2.30.1 x64. A specially crafted HTML web page can cause ause-after-free condition, resulting in a remote code execution. The victimneeds to visit a malicious web site to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
